intro: Erythronium americanum f. castaneum, commonly known as the red trillium, is a rare and striking plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in rich, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological studies and horticultural interest. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in many regions.
